entry.title: Manhunt for Wanted Man Who Eluded Law Enforcement (Photo)
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN, Ore. - A wanted man eluded law enforcement Wednesday evening following a vehicle pursuit. On Wednesday, January 24, 2024, shortly after 5:00 pm, a deputy attempted to stop a silver 2008 Ford Focus near the 800-block of John Long Road in Oakland. The driver failed to stop for the deputy and attempted to elude at a high rate of speed driving southbound on Interstate 5. Near the Oakland exit, a Sutherlin Police Officer was able to successfully deploy spike strips on the eluding vehicle. The driver of the Focus later crashed into a ditch and fled on foot near Interstate 5, Exit 136 in Sutherlin. The driver of the vehicle, later identified as Billy James Best of Seaside, Oregon, was believed to be armed with a handgun. Law enforcement issued a “reverse 9-1-1” call to the area using an alerting system to notify area residents. DCSO, Sutherlin Police Department and Oregon State Police searched the area for hours with assistance of canines without success. Best has multiple warrants for his arrest including new crimes committed during the elude. There remains a heavy law enforcement presence in the area searching for Best, although it is believed he has likely left the area. “We ask the community to remain vigilant and report any suspicious activity to 9-1-1," Lt. Brad O'Dell said. A female passenger, Christina Marie Dominguez of Cave Junction was taken into custody for Unlawful Possession of Methamphetamine. Best is described as a white male adult, approximately 6'00" tall weighing approximately 200 lbs, with several tattoos. He was last seen wearing dark clothing at the time he ran from police. Booking photos of Best from 2022 are being released to assist in his apprehension.

entry.title: Georgia Stiles, volunteer and community leader, dies at 91
entry.summary: Georgia Lee Hoover Stiles, who was an active volunteer and business woman, died Jan. 18 at age 91.

entry.title: ROSEBURG MAN ARRESTED FOR ALLEGED MENACING INCIDENT
entry.summary: January 22, 2024 9:50 a.m. A Roseburg man was arrested for an alleged menacing incident on Friday night. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said just after 10:30 p.m. a 25-year old man and the victim got their vehicle stuck on Akin Road near Julian Lane in the Winchester area. The report said this caused...

entry.title: SHERIFF’S OFFICE INVESTIGATING A BURGLARY IN THE AZALEA AREA
entry.summary: January 22, 2024 9:30 a.m. The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office is investigating a burglary in the Azalea area. Sunday morning at 11:30 a.m. a victim reported that within the last week someone entered his property in the 400 block of Upper Cow Creek Road, got into some of the cabins and stole two batteries, a...

entry.title: ONE TAKEN TO HOSPITAL AFTER SINGLE VEHICLE WRECK
entry.summary: January 22, 2024 9:20 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: One person was taken to the hospital after a single vehicle wreck on Sunday night. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said just before 8:45 p.m. the 18-year old woman was driving south on North Fork Smith River Road in the Reedsport area, when her vehicle...

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 1.22.24
entry.summary: Coach Dave York and players Daniel Withers and Tygue Barron from the Umpqua Valley Christian School baseball team talk about their First Pitch Dinner fundraiser happening February 3rd at the Danny Lang Event Center at Umpqua Community College. Tickets are now on sale. Click here to download for later listening: 830 1 22 24

entry.title: Feeding Umpqua received semitruck of food
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Feeding Umpqua received a semi-truck load of food Friday from Wanda and Steve Olsrud, owners of Sherm’s Thunderbird Market.

entry.title: UACT presents 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
entry.summary: Umpqua Actors Community Theatre will present 20,000 Leagues Under the Seas from Feb. 1-Feb. 8.
